summary: This document is a chain of emails from 2020-2021 between defense attorney Glen McGorty and federal prosecutors regarding scheduling and preparation for a witness interview and trial in the Epstein case. It discusses a proffer agreement, witness testimony about interactions with Customs and Border Protection (CBP) employees in the Virgin Islands related to Jeffrey Epstein, and trial scheduling.

persons.name: Glen McGorty
persons.context: Managing Partner at Crowell & Moring LLP representing a witness (Mr. [REDACTED]) in the Epstein case. He corresponds with prosecutors about scheduling interviews, proffer agreements, and trial preparation.

persons.name: Daniel Zelenko
persons.context: Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) copied on emails discussing witness interviews and proffer agreements.

persons.name: Danielle Giffuni
persons.context: Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) copied on emails regarding witness interviews and case coordination.

persons.name: Josh Morrissey
persons.context: IT group member at Crowell & Moring LLP who was to be included in a WebEx meeting invitation to ensure technical readiness.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the subject of the investigation. Prosecutors plan to ask a witness about Epstein's interactions with CBP employees in the Virgin Islands and any favors done for them.

connections.description: Attorney and prosecutor communicating about witness interviews, proffer agreements, and trial scheduling in the Epstein case.
Attorney and prosecutor corresponding on case matters, including witness preparation and document execution.
Attorney requesting IT staff be included in a meeting invitation to ensure technical setup.
Both are Assistant U.S. Attorneys for the Southern District of New York working together on the Epstein case.

events.title: Jury Selection Scheduled
events.description: The court issued a scheduling order stating jury selection will occur during the week of November 15, 2021.

events.title: Trial Start Date
events.description: The trial is scheduled to begin on November 29, 2021.

events.title: Witness Interview via WebEx
events.description: A second interview with a witness (Mr. [REDACTED]) was scheduled for 1pm to discuss his interactions with CBP employees and Jeffrey Epstein in the Virgin Islands.

events.title: Proffer Agreement Executed
events.description: A fully executed proffer agreement was exchanged between the defense and prosecution, related to a witness's cooperation.

keyFacts: Prosecutors planned to question a witness about Jeffrey Epstein's interactions with Customs and Border Protection (CBP) employees in the Virgin Islands, including any steps taken to help Epstein or his companions avoid normal entry processes.
The witness was represented by defense attorney Glen McGorty of Crowell & Moring, and a proffer agreement was executed to govern his cooperation.
The trial was scheduled for November 2021, with jury selection the week of November 15 and the trial beginning November 29.

The document reveals investigative focus on potential corruption or special treatment provided to Epstein by CBP officials in the Virgin Islands, including possible favors like trips to Epstein's island.
Multiple email addresses and names of prosecutors and defense counsel are redacted, indicating the involvement of other individuals whose identities are protected.
